definitions: To grow or develop in a healthy or vigorous way, especially as the result of a particularly favorable environment.
To wave (something) around to attract attention.
To make a bold, sweeping gesture.
To be at the peak of one's development or influence.
examples: The plants flourish in the rich soil.
He flourished the sword above his head.
She flourished her hand to indicate the exit.
The arts flourished during the Renaissance.
